metadata.title: CVE-2017-9712 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android, with all Androidreleases from CAF using the Linux kernel, if userspace provides a too-largeIE length in wlan_hdd_cfg80211_set_ie, a buffer over-read occurs.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9712` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
